title: Jurrasic Park Font
content:
Anyone know what the Jurrasic Park font is?   
   
Thanks
author: union

comments.content: (Link removed because it's a knockoff of a commercial font)
I think it's Kabel or Lithos or one of those.

Uh oh. I'm way off again. Well it's 6.00pm now and not so great for type id-ing too, I guess.   
   
I don't think it's Neuland either.
Edited out the link I had posted before. Yet another case of freeware not being quite so.

This font apears in some freefonts websites, named "african", and the designer is Allen R. Walden.   
   
in this link have the colection of fonts designed by Allen.   
   
 [http://freefonts.fateback.com/allen\_walden/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649/http:/freefonts.fateback.com/allen_walden/)

again? freeware? now i'm insulted. Universal Studios and freeware? ahhhh...   
   
   
   
David Hamuel
I remember there was a site dedicated to "famous fonts", that were in film titles and famous album covers and stuff like that...

[There still is](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649/http:/www.smackbomb.com/famousfonts). Though, as it seems, they now only provide an ID when it's a commercial font.   
Nice move on their part (though I have to say I think some foundry must have sent them the standard cease-and-desist).

I posted the actual logo used for merchandising the film. It looks a bit more condensed than the sample above. See for yourself :D   
   
 ![JPlogo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16793.gif)

![Jurassic_Park.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16561.gif)   
   
We had this one quite recently on the [Type ID Pop Quiz](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/7876.html?1064077824).   
It's Rudolf Koch's Neuland if I'm not mistaken.

It's not exactly that, but Neuland certainly was the   
source material to develop the movie's title. Check   
which different versions/digitizations exist. The   
one by [Nick's Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/jungle-fever-nf/jungle-fever-nf/testdrive.html?s=Jurassic%20Park&p=48) is free BTW.

Here's [FFD Neuland Inline](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5EW) and [Newton Inline](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5H6), both   
available through [Fonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649/http:/www.fonts.com/).

Sorry Josep, but that's the link that Adriano edited   
out because it's a knock-off of a commercial font.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/plain.gif)

Nonono, you've got it back to front, David. If   
anything the Jurassic Park logo was first. It's not   
uncommon that [knock-off fonts based on movie](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/15918.html?1063247603)   
 [logos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131202023649/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/15918.html?1063247603) pop up whenever such movies get popular.   
Furthermore the _African_ font looks like a rip-off of   
_Neuland Inline_, not of the Jurassic Park logo.
